title: ICE when using Bevy's Taskpool

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
My Cargo.toml ```toml [package] name = "rust_bug" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" # See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html [dependencies] bevy = { version = "0.10.1" } ``` ### Code ```Rust use bevy::tasks::{Scope, TaskPool}; fn main() { let pool = TaskPool::new(); pool.scope(|_s: Scope<()>| {}); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.1 (8460ca823 2023-03-20) binary: rustc commit-hash: 8460ca823e8367a30dda430efda790588b8c84d3 commit-date: 2023-03-20 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.68.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler\rustc_infer\src\infer\region_constraints\mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 0, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:8 ~ rust_bug[783e]::main::'_), '_) }) <= ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 0, kind: BrNamed(DefId(42:101 ~ bevy_tasks[e101]::task_pool::{impl#2}::scope::'scope), 'scope) }) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/8460ca823e8367a30dda430efda790588b8c84d3\compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:987:33 ```
